alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:21PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON... SOUTHEASTERN GREENSVILLE...SOUTHWESTERN ISLE OF WIGHT...SOUTHAMPTON AND SOUTHEASTERN SUSSEX COUNTIES...THE CITY OF FRANKLIN AND THE CENTRAL CITY OF SUFFOLK THROUGH 1045 PM EST... At 1021 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Seaboard, or 9 miles southwest of Boykins, moving northeast at 85 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Boykins around 1025 PM EST. Newsoms around 1030 PM EST. Franklin, Courtland, and Hunterdale around 1035 PM EST. Sedley around 1040 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Bryants Corner, Worrell, Dory, Pleasant Grove, Sunbeam, Lees Mill, Kilby, Walters, and Branchville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
